I will make this hotel my second home.

everyoneShouldKnow: Before you unpack check the water at the tub and check the phone. Do not say you have a car or you will be penalized by having to pay a parking fee.

comment: First night, no phone. Second night, we were told it was fixed. There was even a new phone and index card placed as if it was fixed; but, it was not working. everyoneShouldKnow: Very fine service!

The hotel's staff is as friendly and customer oriented as any that I have met. Restaurant and room service provide excellent food. I would stay here again. Thanks for your fine service and hospitality.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Disney access
title: Excellent Remodel
comment: I have stayed at this hotel in the past when it had the safari theme, and the recent remodel is a HUGE improvement. The bedding is an area of focus for me, and the new bedding was fresh and comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beach and Boardwalk right across the road, Duval Street 10 minute shuttle ride away....best of both worlds.
title: Very relaxing & comfortable
comment: This was the 3rd of 4 Grandbourne hotels we stayed at on our month long roadtrip and it was, by far, our favourite. Initially, we thought we might regret not being within walking distance of Duval, but that turned out to be a positive. The complimentary shuttle service was very convenient and made Duval Street accessible without being in the middle of the chaos 24/7. Munisa at check-in was efficient and made sure we had all the info we needed to navigate the hotel and the area. The best surprise for us, was that the beach and boardwalk were right across the road. What a great way to start the day. Our room was wonderful...spacious, spotless and well stocked and Iliana kept it that way during our stay. Unfortunately we were only there for 2 nights. Next time we will stay longer.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient, comfortable & caring!

I was particularly disappointed in the way my baggage was kept when I checked it with the bellstaff. It was placed in an unlocked room which was visible and open to the lobby. This was totally unacceptable to me and not at all what I expect from a Grandbourne property. I will shy away from any Sharaton Brand hotels as a result of this experience.

The room was spacious for only one person and meticulously clean (pillows were too soft for me). I really liked the ability of the curtains to block all light. I ordered room service breakfast (which was very good) and exercised the green option of not having maid service on the first night of my stay. This resulted in not having an order form for breakfast the second day. After enjoying the buffet-style breakfast in the hotel restraurant, there was a delay in obtaining change for $20, but they held the 7 am shuttle for me. Thanks!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is very professional and the the rooms are always clean.

The hotel is always clean and the staff is always friendly and accomodating. The hotel is in a great location and offers competitve rates. I would highly recommend this hotel!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service

comment: I stayed at this hotel from 2/26 through 3/2. The hotel location is excellent and the staff very good. Alixis in particular was extremely helpful with some requested I needed. The hotel has only one downside which is the gym. The gym is extremely small considering the size of the hotel. There is one weight bench and the ceiling is very low so any overhead exercises are not possible. Also the cardio equipment is dated. As noted, the remainder of the hotel is top notch, except for the gym.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, friendly staff

comment: We stayed at the hotel this past weekend for the New Orleans Rock and Roll Marathon. The trip and stay were great, however, on the ride home, we realized our daughter left her school library book in the room. Tears followed. I contacted the hotel by phone followed by an email. The staff was responsive. I didn't think we'd ever see that book again and would have to pay the library for a new book, not to mention, more tears from my daughter. Low and behold, Angele came to the rescue- the book was found! They are sending it back to us! I know it seems nominal, but it wasn't to our daughter. They made our day and are saving her book report! Thank you to the hotel for jumping on this!

title: The hotel is worth less than what you are paying to stay.
comment: My experience at the Belvoir was not horrible by no means. The front desk greeted me by name and they have great facilities. What was disappointing was the fact that when I arrived the parking was full and there was not anyone to hep with where to park. When I got to my room I found that my pillow case was dirty the first and then didn't get changed the for second night. I could not enjoy a bath because the tub had a stain ( the newly remodeled room). The second night I was there I had to call house keeping to come change my sheets and no one was sent up. That same night I waited in the DRAFT to place a togo order and had to ask someone to wait on me. Once I got back to my room I then found out that my order was wrong and had to go back down to have it corrected. I know these are small things but to pay a hundred dollars a night or more I expect better.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is very accommodating and easy to work with.

The management there remembered me, and spoke to me daily about my stay. The rooms had plenty of space, and were comfortable. The hotel and staff deserves a great deal of respect for helping my colleagues and I to have a great stay in Columbus.

everyoneShouldKnow: Calm and relaxing

We were extremely impressed and pleased with the overall look and feel of the hotel, the cleanliness of not just the rooms but the hallways, lobby, and Indoor Pool Area (which my children loved!), and the very friendly Staff. Id like to mention, Mandi at the front desk, Brenda who was on the cleaning staff and was a delight to talk with, and Shae and Rebecca at the Starbucks coffee shop. All of whom were smiling and very helpful. It was very obvious the time and care that has gone into this hotel. I see some reviews that I think are a little harsh after all; this is not purported to be a 4 or 5 star hotel but rather a 2 star and for such, this hotel is an excellent value.

We stayed in the club room so we enjoyed the appetizers/drinks the lounge had to offer which of course was a treat because we didnt expect that. Pool had very comfortable water temperature. All in all, would defintely go back again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Pleasant place to stay. The room with the view of the river is very comforting.

title: Anniversary Celebration
comment: It was a last minute decision, we booked a room online using points and cash. We arrived and asked for a specific room, however, we could see and was told that the hotel was booked and that particular room was not available. I mentioned to the staff member, Samantha, that we were celebrating our anniversary - she responded " give me a minute, let me see what we can do" Samantha tracked down one of the managers, Ben, and for what seemed like a long time (but prob. was only 2 or 3 minutes) they clicked and clacked and found us the room we wanted only on a different floor. This was the start of a great weekend in which we had drinks and snacks @ the bar, Dinner late that evening and a great breakfast in our room the following morning all without leaving the hotel. .

The Bay tower is really quiet and rooms are larger. The two towers are not connected by a covered walk way. To walk to either you are exposed to the elements. This Hotel is so convient to the airport, gaslamp dis. and shopping. Hats off and special thanks to Blanca at the front desk, she works both towers and is a joy! I let people pass in front of me, just so I can have my turn to be waited on by her. If business (marina tower) Pleasure (bay tower) Enjoy, I Did!

comment: Hotel has great features and is in a really good location,,, but the service is inconsistent. The bellmen are very friendly. I encountered two front desk staff . The first was very friendly and helpful, the secend was basically just doing her job. No smile.

everyoneShouldKnow: The whole facility was so clean and the staff was wonderful.
title: Beautiful and Convenient to Everything
comment: Our suite was absolutely wonderful. We did not know about the shuttle service at first but caught on quickly . Great service . The staff was wonderful. The whole property was so very clean and we felt so safe. OverAll this facility was A1A....Thanks for making our first trip to Key West so enjoyable.

everyoneShouldKnow: the gym equipment is horrible. Please fix the tv in 904.
title: Clean & Friendly but Lacking...
comment: Overall, the hotel is nice, the food was good and the staff was friendly. However, the fitness center is a joke (except for the cadio which is fine). Also, if you want to use the lobby internet computers, be prepared for "dial-up" type speeds. Lastly, the television signal goes crazy about every 15 seconds for unknown reasons. I was there 3 nights and this was a major annoyance which no one in the hotel could explain or fix.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good value, clean hotel
title: Nice,Clean Belvoir
comment: I initially stayed at this hotel because I received a low rate for a single night stay with my wife.

everyoneShouldKnow: For 169.00 a room, I felt like we had a suite!
title: Wonderful Time!
comment: This place has everything you need! The Beds are wonderful! I have no idea where they buy their pillows, but they are the best I have ever put my head on. After a long day in NYC we came back to a clean and comfortable place to stay. The staff was friendly, over the top to help. The fairy is right outside the hotel. You can get your tickets at the front desk. They have a indoor pool, which we didn't use, but will the next time we stay there.

everyoneShouldKnow: Does not live up to what one would expect for this brand and price
title: Food was terrible,pool way too small and extra charges were out of line
comment: For a first class hotel the food was terrible - at the main restaurant - we tried twice and both meals were very poor quality. Also the pool is way too small for a property of this size - people were actually fighting over pool chairs and finally charging for wireless service in this day and age is not competitive - I would not recommend this facility to anyone and will not stay there again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Caveat emptor: mkae sure your reservation is solid at this hotel.
title: Don't expect your confirmation to honored
comment: I have been a an BPG member for over 10 years and have booked at several Grandbourne facilities in PA and other other states and have never been told that there was no room available upon my arrival. Evidently this hotel doesn't give much credence to the room committments it makes. The room, I was finally given was one of the noisest I have ever been in. I was offered another room at the hotel "down the street". If I had wanted to stay in that hotel, I would have booked there. I will not make any future reservations at this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Accommodations!
title: A Great Place to Stay
comment: Very pleased. Everything about this hotel was great! I loved my room, especially the bed. All 3 nights, I slept great. Also, loved the breakfast bar. I highly recommend this hotel to all DC area travelers. You will not be disappointed.

title: The Only Hotel To Stay In Columbus
comment: Stayed here numerous times and always happy with the staff and facilities. Check in always a breeze (Alex makes it so), and breakfast good and quick (I can't remember the names but they know by breakfast order by memory). Rooms always clean.

title: Mixed bag
comment: Impressive lobby area and atrium. Pleasant pool area. Rooms generally comfortable but bathroom is rather tiny given the size of the room, and stained upholstery in the sitting area was a bit of a put off. My one major complaint however was the inadequate air conditionning - we never managed to set a comfortable temperature even when we set the thermostat into the lhigh 60s! Front desk staff are generally welcoming but should not be tasked with providing pool towels along with everything else - standing in line at the front desk to get a pool towel is not in keeping with Belvoir standards.

everyoneShouldKnow: Basic Hotel....Economical
title: Good Location Near the North End
comment: I've stayed at the Belvoir Fisherman's Wharf Hotel a couple of times. This is a small hotel in a very touristy area. It has a small lobby.

everyoneShouldKnow: Well laid out hotel....you will not be disappointed!
title: Nice Hotel...nice pool
comment: I've stayed at the hotel several times on business and with my family. If you want to stay in Palo Alto, it is very conveniently located.

everyoneShouldKnow: NO HOT WATER PRESSURE IN SHOWER

comment: I've stayed at the Belvoir Houston Brookhollow several times.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good option near the galleria. Traffic can get backed up on the road in front of the hotel during peak times making it difficult or a long wait to pull into the hotel entrance.
title: Good Hotel Near the Galleria
comment: Not too much to say about this hotel. My stay was for 3 nights and I wanted to be near the Galleria. I was on the Grandbourne Preferred Floor (Floor 14) and my room was well maintained and very clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Dont base your decision to stay on the outside of the hotel.
title: More then I expected
comment: If you have never stayed at this hotel dont knock it based on the outside. I have to say when I saw the hotel from the freeway I was a little nervous as to what my stay had in store. I was traveling for business with my wife and children and had booked on BPG without seeing the hotel in person before. I must say dont judge a book by its cover because the inside of this hotel is great. Its all a deep blue and wooden beam nautical theme. The rooms are the same with beautiful shots of the puget sound, boats, etc. The welcom staff was very friendly and upgraded us to the club floor. The club lounge was great, friendly staff, tasty little snacks. All in all a great place to stay and just outside of downtown Bellevue.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good for meetings
title: Hotel needs work
comment: Room needs improvement. Bathroom door did not close, air conditioner too loud. Shower old and did not drain well.

everyoneShouldKnow: management is unprofessional!!!!!
title: Very Unprofessional
comment: The hotel from the General manager, front desk, security were very Unprofessional. I travel about 323 days a year and i recently stayed at this property and there was a group of teenagers in the lobby that was so loud that i couldn't sleep. I was on the 8th floor and it was still so loud!!!!!! I called the MOD, Front desk, Security and ask them to do something about the noise and they said there was nothing they could do about it in till some group left. First what a security concern letting all these people into the lobby when not registered guest, there was a lot that got by security and was ridding the elevators and walking around on all floors knocking on doors looking for this group. Second I can't believe that this screaming and singing in the lobby went on for 4hrs!!!!! I will never stay at theis property again and go out of my way to tell everyone about the Unprofessional management and staff.

title: Belvoir Lake Buena Vista
comment: Nice upgrades but still some bugs to work out.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Arizona Center next door is great!
title: An idea for you.
comment: House keeping did a great job keeping my room clean and the entire facility looked very nice. I was disappointed with the television package. You had very little to offer for movies, no hbo, no cinemax. If I wanted to rent a movie they were way overpriced. For the amount we payed for the room we should have had free internet and free movie channels to enjoy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel is clean and comfortable.
title: Nice hotel
comment: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, on the BPG "member" level. The room was clean and comfortable (it had a real thermostat, not one of those silly under-the-window noisemakers). The bed was very comfortable. Towels, shampoo and conditioner were also nice. Everything was good except for a few minor details, which are easy to overlook. The biggest negative was the wireless internet. It was horrible. I logged in and got booted out many times, and when I was in it was horrendously slow. I tried to use the wired internet but the cable was too short to reach my computer. Not convenient at all.

everyoneShouldKnow: Front desk is difficult to work with.
title: Not kid friendly
comment: I was there for work and for that it was fine. I would not however bring my family to stay here on vacation. Not a lot of kid friendly restaurants and was a hassle to check in.

everyoneShouldKnow: Under construction

comment: If there wasn't still construction going on, it would be five stars. The occasional noise and construction crew was the only thing that didn't make this stay perfect.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hotel is more for convention purposes

comment: The hotel staff were rude, desk clerk wanted to charge 60.00 more per day, for a different room. Our room very dirty, food under bed and nightstand. bath tub was dirty. Sink was clogged. Too expensive for a run down Room. 170.00 for a steak dinner for 3 people.

everyoneShouldKnow: IF YOU LEAVE ITEMS IN YOUR ROOM THAT ARE NOT HIGH PRICED ITEMS ONE OF THE STAFF WILL TAKE THEM THINKING NO ONE WILL BOTHER ABOUT THE LITTLE STUFF.

everyoneShouldKnow: Hard Rock is just down the street with other stuff to do right there.

everyoneShouldKnow: Lots of opportunity to improve guest services.
title: Not up to BPG Standards
comment: This is the first time that I have written a review for a BPG hotel that I felt disappointed in. It started at the check-in where the young lady checking me in didn't ask for a credit card to cover incidentals. Although I had my card out, I figured they didn't need it and would use the one I have on file through the BPG system and charge purchases there.

title: Great stay
comment: Had a great stay here. Front desk staff was very helpful, and Frank and the convenient shuttle staff was a great way to explore the nearby downtown area. Would definitely return when visiting Louisville.

everyoneShouldKnow: 1.lackof communication among staff
title: A lot of inconvenience
comment: Let me share with everyone the kind of service weve received from this hotel and their staff, from the day of our arrival to the day of our departure. I have reserved two rooms in this Hotel, two weeks before our arrival to see the Miami game with the following (two connected rooms one with King Bed and the other room with two queen-sized bed for our friends children. On the day of our arrival in Miami around noon I called the hotel to let them know that we will be checking in by 4:00pm, the staff that answered the phone assured me that the two rooms weve reserved are ready and will be waiting for us. But then, when we got there, a lady from the registration desk told us that only one room is ready and that the second room (connected to one room) should soon be ready so she gave us the keys for only one room. After about 30 minutes I called the front desk to see if the second room is ready, another lady talked to me with a different tone on her voice and said the room will not be ready for another 30 to 45 minutes, I was very unsatisfied at that moment so I asked her why then she said there is nothing she can do the guest that was staying on that room had checked out late so their just starting to clean the room. After 20 minutes my husband came out the room and so the cleaning lady just got done cleaning it so my friend went downstairs, and a guy said that the room is not ready and it should be ready by the time we get back from the game so she went back to the room .Ive asked my husband to come with me down the front desk to talk to a manager about the whole thing. When we asked for a manager a Supervisor offered to talk to us and shell try to help us she said. We told her exactly what was happening and that we are very dissatisfied of all the staff that we talked to she apologized and asked us what she could do to ease our disappointment so we asked her to find if the room is ready and that because of all the delay that we should also have a late check out. She asked us what time we want to check out and we said 6:00pm if thats possible she said yes and she also said the room is ready but, there are no 2 queen beds in any of the rooms, but they can and will provide us a bed (a folding bed which by the way, my friends back ached so bad the next day). So that was the end of our first day, The next day on our way to eat breakfast, I went to front desk just to make sure that we are checking out at 6:00pm, what a surprise when the lady I was talking said it was not entered into the system at all, that if we had checked out at six they would charge us a full day extra. Thank God I went back to check before it was too late. So everything is set, we went out,came back around 5pm , guess what? We were locked out! Our keys were not reprogrammed to check out by 6pm so my husband went down to the front desk wanted to talk to the manager once and for all. But the lady he was talking to giving him more excuses for what happened instead of calling the manager so my husband just had enough , he just asked the keys to be reprogrammed. Overall, we had a great time in Miami except for the services that weve had from this hotel and made us all feel not to come and check in to any Belvoir hotel ever.

everyoneShouldKnow: Consider leaving car here after spending the night and catching that morning flight
title: Solid, and quiet, airport hotel
comment: For over 10 years this hotel has met my needs when I've needed a reliable rest prior to an early morning flight. Reduced or free parking (policies and plans vary) and a good shuttle make this all suite hotel a logical choice. I'd prefer to have a more comprehensive and festive restaurant on this campus of three Grandbourne properties, especially as I am often with a friend about to start a vacation, but the burger-oriented Relish bistro excels in its specialty, and also offers sufficient variety for my 3 or so yearly visits.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor service and management
title: Awful service
comment: Staff was clearly overwhelmed during our group visit. Rooms had insufficient towels upon arrival, housekeeping did not replace used items (Coffey, shampoos, etc), removed towels from rooms without replacing. Our group breakfast buffet that we were charged $15 pp for consisted of grits, bacon strips, and scrambled eggs, without coffee, tea, or bakewares, not even toast. We ordered breakfast bags to go on day of departure: the hotel forgot!

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't let the Belvoir brand fool you at this outstanding property with great value for Elite Members.
title: Exceeded All My Expectations
comment: I have to admit that I have not been a big fan of the Belvoir portfolio within Grandbourne as my experience with the brand has been inconsistent over the years. However, I believe this property sets the standards on what the Belvoir brand should be and could be!

everyoneShouldKnow: It is well worth the money!
title: I dont know what everyone is talking about
comment: I stayed here on 2/20/12 to 2/24/12, the last two days of Mardi Gras and a few extra days for the sights. First of all for wanting to see the sights this hotel is right where you wanna be close to everything including the trolley. The staff was AMAZING, they were nice as could ever be, real southern hospitality. No matter what it was from questions to extra coffee they were on it FAST. The rooms were very clean although yes the bathrooms needed remodeling but they are in the process of this very thing. Never heard any construction noise or other quests for that matter, very quiet and relaxing. The views were beautiful and stretch as far as the eye can see. The parking is pricey at almost 37 a night but you can take your car out and bring it back as much as you want no extra charge. It also doesn't hurt that they have one of 3 starbucks in town, downstairs open 9am to 5pm daily. Oh and that their in room coffee is also starbucks, hats off guys! I have stayed in many 4 star hotels throughout the USA and I must say they have well earned their stars.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great valets!
title: Nice hotel near the airport
comment: I recently visited the Belvoir Gateway LAX for a whirlwind 18 hour trip to LA. Upon arriving to the property, I was promptly greeted by a very cordial valet. In fact, every time I pulled up, the valets were so friendly and an ideal first impression of the hotel. The front desk was slow. Both agents I encountered were very friendly, but didn't move with any sort of urgency, instead demonstrating uncertainty. When I took a shower in the morning, the tub was very slow draining and in my brief shower, about an inch and a half of standing water accumulated. I mentioned this to the front desk when checking out, so another guest did not have the same experience and was apologized to and offered a meager apology with some BPG points. All in all, the staff was friendly and wanted to make sure I had a good time, but recovery and urgency was lacking at the front desk.

title: It's just an OK hotel
comment: The location of the hotel was great, the lobby was very nice but once inside my room, I was disappointed.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't rely on shuttle service.

comment: We did a 10 day park and fly package at this hotel on 3/2/12. Upon our return on 3/10/12, we were left at airport for over 1 hour & 15 mts. Were constantly told shuttle would be there in 5 minutes during this period. Three shuttles passed us right by. We were returning from Fla. and standing out in the cold for over an hour was unacceptable. Would have been better if we were told that shuttle would take over an hour. Next time we will book a

comment: My partner and I travel a little too much and we WERE faithful patrons of another chain due to several bad experiences we decided to go with the Belvoir...Well, what an unbelievable weekend....

comment: WE stayed at this hotel for christmas 2011 they gave us an upgrade of an oceanfront room it was beautiful best christmas in the island of oahu . It was Awesome. the shopping center and facilities at Belvoir waikiki are wonderful. the hotel has a wonderful buffet The Hotel is centrally located . you can walk everywhere to the beach the shopping Planning to go back and stay there in spring of this year WOW

title: Surpassed our expectations
comment: For the price we were expecting much less. Our rooms were newly renovated and designated for Preferred Guests. Checking in and out was painless. I definitely will stay there every time I'm in the area.

everyoneShouldKnow: OUTSTANDING SERVICE FROM THE STAFF
title: OUTSTANDING SERVICE
comment: HOTEL HAS A BEAUTIFUL VIEW, ATTRACTIVE LOBBY ANS ROOMS. IT IS WELL MAINTAINED. STAFF GOES OUT OF THEIR WAY TO BE HELPFUL, FRIENDLY AND CHEERFUL.

everyoneShouldKnow: My only negative for my experience is that the third party parking cost is very high in my opinion. For a weekend visit, the rate should be lowered.
title: Club Lounge Experience
comment: The staff person for the evening I was at the hotel, Ms. Jackie, is one of the most hospitable people I have even met. She made each guest feel like they were the only person in the lounge.

title: great location; lacking housekeeping
comment: Excellent location, great views. For the most part the room was clean although the light switches and light fixture itself had not been cleaned for some time. There seemed to be a dark shadow around the light fixture and upon examination I touched it to see if it was a stain and a big piece of dirt/fluff fell on the floor. The same was on the light fixture itself and in the connecting room bathroom to ours.(I took pictures) After waiting 2 hours for housekeeping to help us with remaking a bed that our child had been sick in we had to call again. Felt that was a bit long to wait. Also parking was an issue. There were events at the hotel 2 of the 3 nights we were there. We were told we could only park in 1 parking lot as the other was reserved for the events. After paying$22 per day to park we felt that we were not as valued as the patrons who only needed parking for the evening. With a small child and an infant, parking in the dirt parking lot quite a distance away was an inconvenience. Other than these issues it is a great hotel with a beautiful view.

everyoneShouldKnow: Do not stay on 1st floor.
title: Not the Belvoir you expected
comment: Our room on first floor was very small. I called front desk as my phone near the bed was not working. Nobody came and fixed it. The alarm clock was not working either. They should never rent out 1st level rooms near the parking lot as you hear cars in the parking lot. The amenities and the room is no better than any 2 star hotel. Not what you expect at Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel has a great staff.
title: Changes for frequent stay folks
comment: Was disappointed that after all these years of staying with this hotel, they stopped access to the Club Lounge for Gold members. You need to be Platinum to access it now. I love their great staff, but will likely find another hotel next time.

everyoneShouldKnow: Wait to park until after check-in. The 2 wings have plenty of close parking, but the wings are spread out. The valets are wonderful to assist and suggest the best place to park.
title: 3rd stay
comment: We stayed one night this time to ease an early airport drop off at PHX. As platinum members we have been upgraded the other 2 stays, but were told the hotel was full. There was also no late check out for the same reason. I wish I had known this information on check-in as it made the logistics difficult for an airport pick-up later in the day.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor maintenance

comment: On business trip and the internet does not work most of the time. Hotel response was when hotel is full the Internet does not work well.
