title: Room & Pool were nice. Bus to Disney - not so much
comment: Stayed 6 nights at this hotel in early March 2012. The room was recently renovated and comfortable. Pool area appeared to be all new and was above expectations. Staff was helpful.

everyoneShouldKnow: Dont stay here.
title: Dont stay here!!
comment: Terribly small rooms, rude front office staff.Paid to much for bad level of service and bad rooms. Double billed. Still trying to fix. This experience ruined our weekend and days off.

everyoneShouldKnow: down the block from Canal Room and Pearl Paints.
title: great new hotel, perfect for a Soho/Tribeca visit
comment: Really nice new hotel with reasonable pricing and small but functional rooms (about normal for NY).

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location, comfortable room but pricey add-ons.
title: Comfortable Stay
comment: The hotel staff were friendly at each interaction. They offered us printed directions to places we wanted to go and always had a smile. The rooms were large, clean and comfortable and the location was within walking distance (less than 10 minutes) to so many St Louis attractions.

everyoneShouldKnow: not the best choice in the area
title: paper thin walls
comment: while the hotel has undergone some renovations and the rooms LOOKED nice, the walls are paper thin and we could hear every single word spoken next to us or in the hall near us.

title: no basic need
comment: no basic need equipment in the room like freeze and microwave.

everyoneShouldKnow: The rooms are spacious and clean! The staff are polite and helpful. For a downtown hotel security was top notch!
title: Spacious rooms, ample parking and attention to security, and a helpful and knowledgable staff!
comment: My husband and I and our grown children, had a wonderful stay at this Wilmington downtown location for our 25th Wedding Anniversary!. We were greeted upon arrival, helped with luggage and given great directions to everything we needed to find in Wilmington. We enjoyed the pool and gym areas. The restaurant had no problems seating a party of 13 for lunch at last minute notice. We enjoyed room service for breakfast and the food was warm and enjoyable!. The rooms were clean and spaceous. We liked having a separate bedroom we could close off from guest, or put the grandkids in to play games or enjoy a movie on, while the adults visited in the other section of the room. I highly recommend this wonderful hotel and will return to it on my next stay in Wilmington. Good Internet or Grandbourne rates for the space!

title: The new look is great, the pool is great.
comment: The F&B staff was unfriendly and needed to pick up the pase. On Tuesday at the outside bar during a beautiful day you had staffed a blonde girl. I had sat at the bar ready to order some drinks and I could see that she was busy with a guest making frozen drinks. Which I know can be a pain...but as she was preparing the drinks more guests had approached the bar. Not at any moment did she greet myself or any of the new guests that stepped up to the bar. The total process took over 10 minutes with her going inside to grab things and coming back out. Maybe she was having a bad day but in hospitality you dont need to reflect that towards the guests in the sun.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Value for a superior hotel
title: A Great Hotel at Exceptional Value
comment: We have been staying at The Belvoir Portsmouth for years, and it just keeps getting better. The rates are great, the rooms clean and inviting and the staff is exceptional. They welcome our dog James with open arms. Great location in downtown Portsmouth.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is safe walking distance from the hockey games.
title: Staff
comment: When I was checking in the computer was not wanting to work. Mr. Mitchell was trying his best to get the system to work. Mr. Mitchell was very professional and apologetic with the issue he was having. I always stay at this hotel when I am in the St Louis area. I have never had a problem during a stay. I would like to thank Mr. Mitchell again for his professionalism.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is very close to Universal Studios and the Gibson.
title: Quick but worth it!
comment: We had booked a room for 1 night for a specific event but it was very worth it. The staff was friendly and the hotel was beautiful. I had asked to get a late check out due to my event, and they were more than accomodating. The beds are some of the most comfortable I have ever had. Everyone from the concierge, to the desk staff and bell staff were amazing. I would recommend this hotel and I plan on going back soon.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenience, comfort and very good value for travel with your dog.
title: Large Rooms, great bay views.
comment: We had a very nice large, king room overlooking San Diego Bay and North Island. The balcony with sliding door was wonderful, as we were able to have our coffee in the morning and a cocktail at night overlooking the bay. It was also nice to be able to turn off the heating and cooling in the room, open the door and get fresh air.

everyoneShouldKnow: Fitness facilities, rooms and club lounge are all excellent. the restaurant menu is tired and the service is sporadic.
title: As Good As it Gets!
comment: I've been staying at the Belvoir Parsippany for over 5 years (not to mention dozens of other Grandbourne properties around the continent). The new renovations are brilliant and timely, the workout facilities are among the best I've experienced, the front desk staff (Justin, Mark and others) are professional and organized. Finally, the Club Lounge, hosted by Mary, is like walking into my Mother's ktichen. Always engaged, interested and in great spirits.(David in the evening is good too!) There is no other place worth trying in the Parsippany area. This hotel will not disappoint.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very much over-priced for what it is...
title: Over Priced
comment: Rooms are dirty,

title: I'd stay here again
comment: I just spent 3 night at the Belvoir Philly and overall enjoyed my stay. Location was good for driving as most of my meetings were outside the downtown area. Highway is right there. As a Platinum I was upgraded to a suite with was very nice and comfortable.

title: Dated facility
comment: I was disappointed by my recent stay at this hotel. Although it was clean and the staff was professional, the decor was extremely dated. I would estimate that the carpets and furniture are at least ten years old. The same goes for the workout facility. Finally, the commuter bus terminal across the street gives guests the sense that crime might be an issue in that neighborhood.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice setting on the beach and close to restaurants and night activity.
title: Great week!
comment: My wife and I stayed for five nights. Hotel is old, but very well maintained and clean.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is classy, fun, perfect location & great views!
title: Amazing view!
comment: We stayed in the Marina tower in room 1028 at the club level. The view of the marina was absolutely breath-taking. We loved having a balcony to enjoy the view. The convenience was great. Minutes from the airport, minutes from Sunset Cliffs, Point Loma & even downtown.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is a clean and comfortable place with excellent staff.
title: Very nice!
comment: This was our first time staying at this hotel. It exceeded our expectations. The staff was wonderful, very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice. It is clean. The breakfast buffet is good and the waitresses are very friendly. It is convenient to everything. We will definitely stay there next time we go to Des Moines.

everyoneShouldKnow: Going through Renovation
title: Denver Tech Center
comment: It would have been nice to know they were renovating the hotel. Rooms were definitely on the small side, especially the bathroom. Very friendly staff and nice breakfast spread. Good internet connection for working in the evenings.

title: Hands Down Best Service
comment: I feel a little strange writing that this Belvoir has the best services hands down, but it's true. I've stayed at BPG properties 400+ nights and this one really sticks out. I guess I have lower expectations for this hotel since it's not a resort, vacation, or big city property, but their service really surprised me. This was the second time I stayed at this location and when I walked up to the counter I was greeted by "Mr. ___, so nice of you to come back". I don't know how they knew my name. The staff was extremely attentive, asking if I knew where the workout facility was, lounge hours, etc. Whoever did the training at this facility did an excellent job and the staff is also doing an excellent job.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Heated Pool is GREAT!
title: Bend over Backwards Staff
comment: While I can see where someone may complain about the carpet cleanliness, what I don't understand is how could anyone find time to complain when they are receiving 5 star treatment. From the time my family of 5 arrived, till the time we left, we were treated as rock stars! Big thanks goes to Jasma and Tristin for getting the room we wanted. And how could we have found our way to Sundance Square without DeWayne giving us a ride and showing us where to eat chocolate cake! From fresh linens and cleaning the room above what we asked Wanda to do, all the way to saying a heartfelt Good Morning to me and my kids- just because! We had a great time!

title: Will the front desk answer the phone, please?
comment: Several attempts to reach the front desk were met with no response. Had to walk down to the desk on 3 occasions.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice location. Great service and rooms are very nice.
title: Great Stay
comment: Great room very comfortable.

title: Thanks Lynn and Tierra
comment: I originally booked a room for two nights at this location. We had a change of plans due to unforeseen circumstances. I explained the situation to Tierra at length and she tried to do the best she could to help. Together with Lynn from Accounting, they were able to remedy my situation. Thank you guys so much!

everyoneShouldKnow: RENOVATION!
title: Keauhou Rising!
comment: I stayed here for the first time recently but had visited the property on previous trips. The hotel is undergoing a renovation and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. The staff could not have been nicer and they made SURE I knew about the renovation and set my expectations accordingly.

title: Perplexed
comment: Very pleasant stay in a well-maintained and conveniently located hotel. Two concerns: the TVs in the workout room and rooms had many cable channels, including all the news, except MSNBC. Is there a political agenda here? If so, get rid of FOX, or include MSNBC, or I will not stay here again. Second, the private lounge on the 44th floor was very nice, but for breakfast, it was very dark--appropriate for a romantic evening, perhaps, but a stupid decision for the morning, when you can barely find a spot to read the newspaper.

title: everything was wrong with the hotel
comment: -Took forever to warm up my food

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent location, comfort, and accommodations.
title: Perfect Key West Location
comment: The Belvoir Key West was the perfection location for a relaxing and spacious resort. The suites are amazing and comfortable. The staff was very attentive, the food was outstanding, and the pool was perfect. Being directly across the street from the beach made it a perfect choice. A short drive to shopping and Duvall Street made it very easy to enjoy our visit to Key West. Loved it and will return often.

title: Boston Blackout
comment: I was a guest at the hotel during the blackout in downtown Boston in March. You see a different side of people during a crisis and I must admit I was very impressed with the professionalism of the staff.

title: Reception staff cold face
comment: not friendly and no smile; checking in late Sunday night Mar 11 I was not asked for my preference of BPG awards, was not given the club floor PIN.

everyoneShouldKnow: Cold swimming pool and small hot tub that appeared not too clean.
title: Pool Too Cold
comment: This hotel seems to be cutting costs by limiting the air conditioning. Thus, if you are assigned a room on the Grandbourne Guest floor at the very top of the hotel, the rooms can be too warm to be comfortable. On the other hand, the pool does not seem to be heated, I never saw anyone swim in it, just sit on the sides dangling their feet in the water. My spouse reported that it felt like ice water. I saw quite a few young people who appeared to be very disappointed. It's also annoying that , even if you are a disabled person, and are not feeling well, you still have to personally check in at the front desk. The rooms have pull out sofas, but the hotel doesn't put sheets or blankets on them, you have to call to get sheets delivered to your room. We got a 2 p.m. checkout, they would not give us 4 pm, and even then the maid kept pestering us, even with the "do not disturb" sign on the door. The hotel does a great job keeping the lobby clean and bright and we liked the coy fish and turtles in the indoor pond. I would try to find another Grandbourne property in the area on my next visit.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great pool area!
title: Great Pool!
comment: Overall, we had a nice stay at this hotel. I will list out the pros and cons with the cons first - it is always nice to end with the positive!

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff care a lot about your comfort.
title: Exceptional Service
comment: My BPG membership was acknowledged by the Valet and the Registration desk. I was given a nice room on the club floor, and the bell desk brought me a refrigerator and extra towels and was very helpful. We had a problem with our door key not working, and the security guard came immediately and treated us to a nightcap for our troubles. We stayed one week and the room was clean and all staff so friendly. The valet Curtis noticed a scrape on my car that I hadn't gotten fixed, and got some polish out and buffed it out. Amazing. Great service, the building has interesting history and great location. Nice gym, and we had a business meeting in the lounge with great service. I did not like the cabana rooms, they are tired... the tower was better. Thanks!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location, good staff, great shopping, everything for the business person and great shopping around the corner and access to trains, no one bothers you on the road and you feel safe.
title: Overall Experience
comment: We stayed at Belvoir Brooklyn from March 8-14 2012 and we welcomed in the evening by the staff. The hotel is great when you see where it is located you are even more surprised. For me there was shopping in every corner Macy's just 'over the road'. I must mention though that I was very impressed with our room cleaner and the room. Keep up the good work but also the restaurant need an accomplised cook/chef.

everyoneShouldKnow: The most comfortable mattresses in any hotel, no competition.
title: Excellent hotel
comment: Wife and I brought our newborn daughter to Chattanooga for a one-day trip. We reserved the Aquarium package which included 2 tickets to the Aquarium, 2 tickets to the I-MAX, and a $10 voucher to Starbucks. The room was top-class, the staff was very friendly, and the location was ideal, right in the middle of downtown Chattanooga. My favorite part of our stay was the king-size bed. It was the most comfortable mattress that I have ever slept on in my entire life, every muscle relaxed as soon as I laid down on it.

title: Staff Support
comment: I was greatly disappointed by the staff and the support they offered. I will probably not stay at this hotel again. I had several request but never got a response. I checked out the next day and that was another story.

everyoneShouldKnow: The 2 double bed rooms are small. The suites afford much more room. Convenient location. EXPENSIVE, even with the conference discount.
title: Boston Blackout
comment: (SVO member/gold status)

everyoneShouldKnow: Close to beach,
title: Very Happy
comment: We had a Great stay!! Our room was clean, comfortable and had an amazing view of the ocean. The staff was friendly, helpful and kind to a person, especially the front desk staff. The parking, while not free, was safe, covered and convenient. We were steps from the beach, the beach area and pools where perfectly located for use and there was great choice of eating options in the hotel and the immediate area. The other quests were mostly adults and families, so we didn't feel surrounded by teens! Great place to stay! Close to everything!

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms are showing their age - but decent hotel overall.
title: Great, friendly staff; however, facilities need improvement
comment: The staff at the Belvoir Meadowlands is wonderful - so accomodating, friendly and helpful. A few things need attention: 1. Rooms are in need of updating - mattresses are a bit saggy, there were dents and scratches on the walls in the bathroom, the shower rod was falling down etc. 2. Wireless internet is very slow in rooms. 3. Please repave your entire parking/driving areas - I thought I was going to puncture a tire when I drove in.

everyoneShouldKnow: check-in is a STRICT 3pm!
title: Nice surprise!
comment: The "gym" has had a well-overdue makeover. THANK YOU!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: it caters to the masses
title: Use only if no other options
comment: The hotel grounds are clean and well maintained. The staff is there to make you "believe" they care but in reality they don't. This resort is catering to the masses and not to anyones particular needs so if you looking for creature comforts I would not recommend this place. A good example is there version of a help. If you go to the ticket and attractions desk they make you go to other desk first. Then that desk just hands you a simple price sheet and has you go back to the first desk you were at. Then the second desk will eventually get to you and just read you what is on the sheet you got with no real help. Then if you ask for something special you have to go back to the other desk. The run around is just not what I like when on vacation. It was too much trouble so we just went online and got our attraction tickets in 5 minutes.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice size rooms, conveniently located just off 101
title: Good Choice
comment: We were only there for one night on our way to Russian River Wine touring but were very pleased with the room and food in the dining room. We also had a drink in the bar and found the prices and selection to be good. It is conveniently located right off the 101.

everyoneShouldKnow: overpriced and needs lots of cleaning up. even the bathrooms in the lobby requireds cleaning (a lot)
title: junior suite
comment: we were very disappointed with the hotel/staff. Upon checking in, they tried to give us room #314. I informed them I paid for a junior suite with a view of the harbor for my wife's 70th birthday. After waiting 15 minutes, they gave us room #727. It had a view (about 30%) the rest of the view was the hotel across the parking lot! Talk about bait and switch!! The junior suite was wasted-lots of unusable space (table about 3'x5' that could not be utilized. Only had coffee maker in room. Tried to exchange decaf for regular coffee-wanted to charge us for the

title: Nothing to improve
comment: The staff and facilitites were the best part about my stay. In particular Sean Parker and Vincent Seiberling were excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good main room size, but bathrooms are small. Sirens going by all night and, even on high floors, it is loud.
title: Average and Loud
comment: This hotel is perfectly average. The main room size is acceptable and my room was clean. The bathroom is really small and the water pressure was very weak in the shower. There were sirens going by at all times and it was pretty loud as a result. The gym amenities were definitely a plus.

title: Hotel is old and tired
comment: The hotel and room are old and tired. Wallpaper peeling, mold in the shower, and sink drain clogged. Service was slow in all areas. I have never seen a front desk operate so slowly when staffed by four people.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's in the heart of Station Square.
title: This hotel was a great choice!!!!
comment: My girlfriend and I were there celebrating her birthday. They upgraded our original suite to a lake view suite. We over looked the lake. It was gorgeous. We had never been to pittsburgh. Everything about this hotel was great: very comfortable bed, clean bathroom, great downtown location, etc......I would truly recommend this hotel to family and friends.

everyoneShouldKnow: I would not refer this hotel to anyone.
title: Unsatisfactory
comment: Sink would not drain, there was black substance in the bathroom sink, the shower would not work, water came out of faucet not the shower head. The internet did not work and I lost a days work because of this service not working.

everyoneShouldKnow: The Staff is so helpful and friendly.
title: EXCELLENT
comment: I took my 18 yr. old granddaughter to New York for the first time.The Belvoir was the perfect pick.Close to the theatres and Times Sq.The Staff was very helpful and friendly.The rooms are clean and spacious I would recommend this hotel and can`t wait for a return trip....

title: Great Hotel
comment: Hotel was very clean and the staff was amazing! Service was first class all the way!

everyoneShouldKnow: don't go for business
title: Not suitable for a conference and not business friendly
comment: General condition of rooms was worn and dated. Price value very low compared to alternatives.

everyoneShouldKnow: Kid-friendly... not so much for adults.
title: Not good for business meetings
comment: The place was full of screaming children, but that is because of it being next to Legoland. Don't hold a business meeting here! Housekeeping knocked on my door to roust me from bed late at night with a pile of towels that I did not ask for, then the hotel tried to bill me for a $7 bottle of water that I did not use. I couldn't contact the hotel manager until after 9am... they don't have a night manager? The self-parking is severely limited, or you have to park far away... and there is no covered walk from the self parking to the hotel lobby, or from the hotel rooms to the lobby, making it very uncomfortable in bad weather. Internet service in the meeting rooms was throttled back to dial-up speeds, so when we cancelled our meeting room for the 2nd day so that we could use nearby office space with decent internet speed, they also inadvertantly cancelled our breakfast meeting, making our whole team late that day because the hotel had to scramble to arrange breakfast for us. Our team bailed and went to the restaurant instead.

everyoneShouldKnow: Family friendly hotel
title: Good Downtown Option
comment: I stayed at the Belvoir Atlanta Hotel for one night after my business conference concluded (at a different hotel in Buckhead). The front desk staff was very friendly, welcoming, and cheerful. Fantasia thanked me for being a Platinum member, described all the hotel amenities, and even asked if I would like a late check out. I was very happy to see that the front desk staff here were well versed in the BPG rewards program.

everyoneShouldKnow: Needs customer service HELP
title: This hotel needs customer service HELP!!!
comment: We were so excited about using our vacation time share package we thought we would arrive and have the red carpet rolled out, boy were we wrong!!! We are ONLY RENTERS not time share owners so it was boldly explained to us. We first checked in and were checked into a dirty villa on the third floor and had taken all of our luggage to and then had to repack our van up go to the front desk to get a new room. When I arrived at the front desk I wasn't even apologized to or asked if they could do anything to make this situation better. We arrived at our second room which was much better. The service was less than good and then upon going to our meeting for the explore package we had instead of 1 hour it took 3 hours to tell the person NO!! He asked what we liked and disliked about the first time we meet with someone and we told her the pressure selling they do. Then he asked how our stay was so far and I told him about how terrible the customer service was setting up the trip and then we were checked into a dirty room. Miguel said that he would take care of us and make sure they didn't something for all the hassel. After the long three hours of us saying NO we aren't going to buy Miguel was mad and left and did nothing for us in regards to the problems we had just as I told my husband he would. This property isn't the property to stay at for the average Joe because they only really give the good customer service to the Grandbourne OWNERS!!! And don't eat at their resteraunts they are DISGUSTING like canned and boxed food and in Zimmy's two of the servers were clearly arguing right out in front of everyone in the dining room and for a disgusting meal it cost us $70 and we had to deal with the arguing!!! I love the room but that wasn't enough for me to put up with the rest of the terrible stay.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice hotel for families and couples.
title: So-so for business travelers
comment: This is a pretty and classy hotel from outside to lobby areas. Conference center looked very nice though I did not attend a conference there.

everyoneShouldKnow: right next to Legoland
title: Disappointed
comment: I love Grandbourne and I am extremely loyal. I hardly every complain because I travel alot and it doesn't take a lot to please me. I was very disappointed with this Belvoir. My toilet was dirty on checkin, I let it go but it was still dirty after my room was cleaned the next day I had to have them come back and take care of it. There were no pens in the room and no breakfast menu when I called down at 11:10 PM to order breakfast they would not take my order so I had to wait for them to bring door hanger menu and pen. I was going to make coffee in the room but there was no sugar.

everyoneShouldKnow: No concierge or executive club.
title: Mixed Bag
comment: The facility is nice overall. The staff is generally very pleasant. The rooms are clean and comfortable. But, as a Platinum, I am continually disappointed in this hotel. The weird thing is, I've brought the issues up more than once to no avail. For instance, I've stayed there the past two weeks. Out of 7 days, I received a newspaper at my room once. And, the gift shop where you can buy necessities, which is operated by a contractor, may just be closed for a solid hour during its normal operating hours. It was last Thursday from about 8:10pm. And then there was the bizarre incident two weeks back when I could not get hold of room service or guest services for at least 30 minutes. No matter what phone button I pushed, I was forwarded to my voicemail. (I had no messages.) Essentially, the hotel's 2nd and 3rd shifts seem to have a poor sense of customer service, while the day crew is much better. One other disappointment - the hotel's concierge club is permanently shut down and closed off. Pathetic.

title: Very Upset
comment: We stay in the Anchorage Belvoir every time we make the trip to Anchorage from Valdez. We have always had wonderful stays up until this point. We checked in and everything seemed fine. We went to bed after traveling a long day and we were awakened by a cell phone which was left under the bed around midnight. Then my dogs were up and awake, four hours later we were awakened by the walls viberating and making a really loud noise. This continued until we left the room on and off every 15 mins or so till 10am. We then gave up on sleeping and dealing with the dogs growling at 7am and decided to shower. We then had very hot- to freezing temp water in the shower, the temp changed alot for me and my husband then showered and his shower was freezing the entire time. We called and spoke with a girl and she said she would get us a room change as soon as she can figure out a room for us to move to. We waited for a phone call back about a room being ready and never got one. So when we left the room for the day we stopped at the front desk to speak with someone and a manager I think said when we came back later that evening he would have a room ready for us, and would give 2000 rewards points in addition to our stay for the inconvience. This was fine I understand problems happen and that would be fine if they fixed the issue. We then came back at the end of the day around 9pm and there was no room ready so we stood in the lobby waiting to move. No notes in the system to move us, or of the issue, or anything. We finally got another room, went to get our things to move to the next room and got in to bed. We made it to 9am before the noise started in this room so that was good, but the shower was still terrible. I did not enjoy a second cold shower. I called the guest service and they told me they would have a manager call me back within 30 mins. No one called me back and I was there till 12. I also had the note on the door saying quiet and I had a housekeeper try to come into the room from 10am on till I left. This wouldnt be that bad if I didnt have my dogs going crazy every time she tried to open the door. Wuth check out being noon it was a little annoying. I am just unhappy with the price and having to move and not having a manager care enough to even talk to us.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very busy with groups - they could care less
title: Horribe service!
comment: Last weekend, I checked in. At 3pm the second day, I called guest services as my room had never been cleaned. They apologized and said housekeeping was on their way. At 4pm, I called again - same story. At 5:30 - I went down there personally. At 7pm, we used a friend's room to shower as we still had no clean towels. Finally - at 7:30, housekeeping arrived. They made the bed and gave new towels but didn't "clean" - Coffee pot still dirty, etc... They told me that there were only 2 on duty!!! Unacceptable!

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient to the LAX airport
title: That was not a warm welcome
comment: I have to start quoting one of the reviewers: "This is hard for me because I love Grandbourne and I love the Belvoir brand (...). I am fortunate to be a Grandbourne Platinum Member (...), so it is with a heavy heart to have to bring a complaint to the public view". Just some more: I travel a lot - at least once weekly, and I use many hotel brands, mainly across Europe (of course Grandbourne is my favourite brand). So I have quite a good knowledge what does "good enough" standard mean. And my expectations are not very high - I just want to have a clean and quiet room and friendly (not "intrusive") staff.

everyoneShouldKnow: This is Belvoir brand one would expect.
title: Very nice and convenient LA downtown hotel
comment: This is what one would expect from Belvoir brand!

everyoneShouldKnow: Awful staff, Internet and overall accommodations.
title: Awful Hotel
comment: I should preface this review with the statement that I have stayed in a lot of Grandbourne hotels during the course of my business and pleasure traveling and I have never been so compelled to write a bad review. But I would have liked to read this before booking this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: The pool is currently closed for renovations
title: The most comfortable Beds & Pillows!
comment: The bed and pillows were amazing! The most comfortable night sleep I have ever spent in a hotel!

title: Adequate but not great
comment: Overall my stay was adequate, but it did not meet my expectations for a Belvoir. First I should note that the staff were excellent. The reservation was under my friend's name, but I had no problems getting added to the room at check in. The concierge was extremely friendly, and chatted with us the next day to ask how our day was.

everyoneShouldKnow: The views are stunning, and beds are comfy!
title: You MUST stay here!
comment: This hotel is beautiful! Walking distance to Navy Pier one way and the other way you walk right to Michigan Ave! Staff is pleasant,. Any extras you need they accomodate! Shula's restaurant is located in hotel as well as other bars, coffee shop and hamburger/ easy finger food.. the beds are so comfortable and it has amazing views of Chicago and the River.

everyoneShouldKnow: Besides the beds being unbelievable comfortable, the staff is some of the most hospitable hotel staff we've ever experienced
title: Amazing hospitality
comment: We have stayed at this hotel several times but last night topped them all. We got engaged yesterday and stayed in celebration. They went above and beyond to make the day and night special for us!! We even woke up to a congratulations card and breakfast for two at the Share restaurant . We especially want to thank the night manager and the front desk! They were great!

title: We had a great stay!
comment: Brand new hotel, tastefully decorated, great gym and spa and located near the marina. We had a wonderful stay!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location is great
title: Disappointed
comment: As far as front desk and location I'll give it 5 star - HOWEVER... the room was small compared to other hotels, we called room service ..an hour later called back to be told it was on its way; an hour later they were now leaving and in elevator.. we finally gave up..it never showed!!!!! After 10pm the kids that stayed at hotel were all sitting outside, stairs covered in garbage and bottles, had to step over everything to get to door.. not much security or control over young guest. The alarm was set twice ... elevators in evening were overrode so we could go up and then next morning at 5:40 am we were woken up again with false alarms. I travel to new orleans extensively and work for an airline, so tend to give info to our passengers if you like location it was great and the front staff was great...but definately go somewheres else for the money I paid.

title: Excellent emplacement
comment: Hotel confortable, chambre silencieuse, spacieuse et bien am鮡g饮

everyoneShouldKnow: Impressive atrium. Large living room suite
title: Brief 1 night stay
comment: We checked in late and our BPG status was not acknowledged. The suite was large and completely renovated. The bathroom was small but quite adequate. The living room was very large and the bedroom was a decent size as well. Both had a large LCD flat screen TV. The entire suite was very clean. Unfortunately we checked out early and didn't really have an opportunity to take advantage of the nice quarters. Upon checkout our BPG status was acknowledged and the reservation person was very friendly.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Value for price
title: Great value for price
comment: Stayed here twice in March and was very pleased. Because the price was very reasonable I was expecting the hotel to be very run down, and that was not the case at all. I was upgraded to the club lounge level and the room and food both met expectations.

everyoneShouldKnow: Helpful Courteous
title: Front desk staff
comment: The front desk staff was very helpful. I had created a problem when making the reservation. They corrected the problem without any hesitation.I will surely stay with Belvoir on my next vacation.

title: Outstanding hotel for BPG members
comment: My girlfriend and I stayed 11 days and the hotel was great. The staff made us feel very welcome in particular T.C in the 10th floor lounge and Susan in the bar. Scored some great seat for a concert from Bob at the ticket office in the hotel. Had a great time and will be back soon!

everyoneShouldKnow: Considering the room rate, the hotel should be held to a commensurate standard, and this facility failed in almost every way.
title: Dismal experience overall
comment: 1. The internet setup in the rooms is abysmal; it is SLOWER than SLOW; the machines are abused and damaged; it took minutes for simple clicks to register in this antiquated software, We would have rather avoided the whole process, but to get wireless service on our laptop, we had to go through a painful process just to get online to get the access code ... which they could have just supplied when we checked in!

everyoneShouldKnow: With free shuttle service to downtown Chapel Hill, you can avoid parking hassles there - and have more fun without having to worry about driving back to the hotel. The employees are super friendly - and will do everything they can to grant your requests.
title: Great people, good property, nice touches
comment: We were very, very unsure about booking the Belvoir Chapel Hill based on reviews on Trip Advisor - and also because a Carolina Football home game might draw a bunch of drunken, unruly fans.

title: Spring Training
comment: I thought the hotel was average at best for the price.

title: The Pros and Cons
comment: So here's the thing, we booked this room for a business trip, just a simple nights stay. Well that simple nights stay was a bit less than simple. Firstly the room location was out of the way up a few stairs and a bit confusing as to its location not being part of the tower. Upon entering the room, the toilet was running, simple enough just jiggle the handle and it stopped. The internet wasn't nearly a strong enough signal for what it cost. It took nearly 15 minutes of trying to connect to the network before giving up and using a smartphone. On a side note, in this day and age many of your competitors offer wi-fi free of charge for their guests. The coffee machine was difficult to turn on requiring quite a bit of force to turn on. In addition to the force required to turn on the coffee maker one had to also brace the machine to prevent it from being knocked over by the force to turn in on. this is both dangerous and unneeded in my opinion.

everyoneShouldKnow: Club Floor evening snacks are great! Breakfast not so great!!
title: friendly staff
comment: Overall it was a nice hotel. I was disapointed in their breakfast on the club floor. I've been on other club floors where they had something "hot" like bacon and eggs. Here they only had cereals, muffins and fruit. Their evening snacks were very nice- hot meatballs, poppers, chicken kabobs, etc. (2 different ones every night). Our third night here we switched to a suite because we were excpeting another person and needed more room. I called down to request a rollaway in the suite. They called me back a few minutes later and told me they only give rollaways to the suites. I had to tell them that I was in a suite. I'm not sure why they didn't already know this! Then a few minutes later they called me back and told me they had no rollaways available and offered to send up extra blankets instead. Then later that night the front dest called me and asked me if I got my rollaway. I had to inform them that they told me they had none. So, they were a little disjointed on communication between the front desk and the service people. We had upgrated to the suite for the rollaway and then didn't get one. So we were alittle squichy on the beds that night. Other than that the beds were comfortable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Inexpensive
title: Air condition
comment: The air conditioning and heating never work right in this hotel

title: Honeymoon
comment: My husband and I were worried about staying here for our honeymoon because of the renovations but we had a great time. The construction was done during the day so it didnt interfere with us. Can't wait to return after the renovations are complete. The bathrooms are a little too cramped for our comfort and the railings on the balcony are a little flimsy. Hopefully they will fix that. Our room was spacious with a beautiful view of the ocean.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Location. Nice bar area and the internet cafe was wonderful.
title: Noisy Toilet and Request Not Met
comment: The room was very nice, except for the noisy toilet. It was probably the loudest toilet I have ever heard and did not flush adequately. We reported it but never heard a response about our request. When we checked out, the reception desk told us it was because it was a low flow toilet. I am not so sure I buy that in that the toilet paper never did flush adequately.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hotel at a great location
title: Wow, what a Change
comment: The hotel renovations are great. The hotel lobby and pool are are fantastic and very impressive. The best thing that did not change is that you kept some of the prior staff. Brenda and John in the restaurant and Janet at the front desk. Brenda is number 1 in customer service and an asset to your hotel. I would reconsider the parking and facility charge. They are excessive and will make people think of staying at other hotels to avoid the $20 charge. Overall, a beautiful hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Nice location, worn out facility and bored staff
title: Staff not familiar with Status Program
comment: This is the first hotel where the BPG program status was not acknowledged at check-in. When I called down to confirm that Gold receives free internet, they said it does not. I have stayed here a few times and each time they seem "worn out by tourists." (both hotel and staff) Though no one was particularly rude, they did not seem to go the extra mile, rather more the bare minimum.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great pool with awesome location to beach.
title: Delightful Stay, Wonderful Time
comment: We just left a nice 5 day stay at the Belvoir Key West. What a lovely hotel with plenty of room for a family of 5. The room had two double beds and a nice pull out sectional that fit us well. Really loved having the mini fridge in the room for drinks and snacks. The grounds are beautiful and my kids loved chasing lizards around the grounds. The staff was very nice. One day they even brought popsicles out to all the kids (and adults) at the pool. Speaking of the pool. What a great place for our three kids to swim while we could catch the basketball scores and have a nice cocktail poolside. The concierge had a long list of recommended activities and restaurants that we took use of. The hotel is on the beach and the Hawaiian ice truck across the street is not to be missed. We were glad we had our car to go to the main part of the city in the evenings. We found parking very easy and the two times we paid was cheap. I think trying to use the shuttle with 5 people would have been hard. We all had a blast - my kids are 3, 7, and 9 and they LOVED Key West. The hotel was a great place for us. Would highly recommend this trip and this hotel. It was perfect for our family.

everyoneShouldKnow: Average room and decor. Great location.
title: Great location, room average.
comment: This hotel is in a great location. It is broken into 4 different buildings. Ask to be in one or 2. Building 3 is in the back with no view. It is dark and unwelcoming at night. The entrance to the actual building you stay in is unattractive and dreary. The room was average except for the fact when i opened the door to my room i walk into a sink. The sink and mirror are right there when you walk in. The tub and toilet are separate. You need to walk out of the bathroom to wash your hands or groom yourself. Uncomfortable if you were sharing a room. Balcony is tiny.and there is no view. The air conditioner is so loud it keeps you from sleeping. Almost as loud as a washing machine. Room was clean and beds comfortable. Coffee and water there every day. Be aware of the daily $10 surcharge and $10 parking fee. These are not negotiable and should be considered when getting a rate. Close to all shopping and restaurants as well as relatively close to Disney. Hotel was average and not what i had hoped from Belvoir.

everyoneShouldKnow: not much parking space
title: family stay
comment: we were very impressed and happy with out stay at this hotel except for check in and parking. The front desk lady did not tell me what floor I was on or where to even go to find an elevator. I had to ask her 2 times where we should park. Biggest problem was finding a parking space especially coming in late. You pay $10 a night for parking and then can't find one. Hopefully this will be resolved soon or they will lose a lot of return visitors. Otherwise the room was very clean and nice and we loved the soft beds and pillows.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you have a problem, particularly with internet you are on your own. Expect to spend hours trying to solve the problem.
title: Unfortunate stay at your hotel
comment: Dear Belvoir Orleans,

everyoneShouldKnow: Tremendous Pools
title: Perfect for Families
comment: This resort is a perfect escape for families. There is something to do for everyone. In fact, there is so much on the property that you might not make it to Disney if it is just a short stay. In our case, the kids loved the pools and the entertainment (especially movie night).

title: Business Stay
comment: This is not a hotel for tourists. But, for those in DC for business, it is perfectly acceptable. Close to the Pentagon but not quite within walking distance for everyone. Also near a Metro after a short walk.

everyoneShouldKnow: Beautiful hotel, warm and friendly staff that will go above and beyond for you, and great location! Their shuttle service to Disneyland was great!
title: Wow, what hospitality
comment: Yes, the hotel was beautiful, the rooms were comfortable and the location was great, but what really made my stay here memorable was how wonderful the staff treated me. I anticipated standard service but the hospitality was definitely beyond what was expected. I was able to change rooms without a problem, store my luggage all day until check in time, enjoy a wonderful breakfast and grab a shuttle to Disneyland without any worries. The staff really took care of me and I want to say thanks again! I recommend anyone traveling for any reason, to stay at the Belvoir Hotel at Garden Grove (make sure its this one because there are like 3 or 4 others in the same area).

everyoneShouldKnow: If taking a cab to this hotel. tell your driver you're staying at the Belvoir Lake Buena Vista. Not one driver referred to it as the "Belvoir Safari."
title: Not what I expected
comment: As a business traveler I dread "Resort Type" hotels, but I was pleasantly surprised by this one...especially by the staff.

title: Above and beyond the call of duty
comment: Vincent went way beyond his job to help us with directions and just all around helpful! Quite an employee (don't lose him)

everyoneShouldKnow: Exceptionally small rooms
title: Club Level
comment: Big improvement in room decor.

title: Exceptional hotel
comment: From the welcoming guest staff to the nightly happy hour, this hotel exceeded our expectations. We were there for spring training (baseball) but enjoyed the pool. We enjoyed the water slide and relaxing pool and hot tub; a great hotel for visiting the area or any spring training event. Housekeeping staff did an excellent job of cleaning the room and hallways and we felt safe throughout our stay. Restaurant staff remembered us from a previous stay! Outstanding service!

everyoneShouldKnow: stiny room front desk workers are lairs never staying at any sherton again
title: bad really bad not happy at all
comment: stiny room front desk workers are lairs never staying at any sherton again

title: Incredible Hospitality
comment: I have stayed all around the world at the best hotels. This place is a little slice of Heaven in comparison. The Belvoir Sand Key Resort provides all the hospitality of an intimate boutique hotel blended with a hometown feel. The staff was just so friendly and helpful. The restaurant staff are careful listeners and got our orders right every time. We never realized what exceptional service is until you truly experience it. At Sand Key, they provided nothing but the best service.

everyoneShouldKnow: Conveniently located, great staff and great accomodations.
title: Excellent Hotel overall
comment: I stay in this Hotel at least every other month. The staff always accomodates my requirements which are to be away from street noises, vending machines and the elevators.

everyoneShouldKnow: Its warm & friendly.
title: Suite Stay As Always!
comment: As a Platinum guest at BPG this hotel is the best in the entire chain when it comes to recognizing its repeat customers! The staff knows me by name. The valet, the front desk & even the front desk managers. They welcome you, they upgrade you if available often prior to your arrival & they make it feel like a second home. Something that is truly lost in this day & age. Its away from the noise, it offers you breakfast, late check outs & upgrades. Great value!

title: Service Problems
comment: Poor communication between front desk and housekeeping made our stay unsatisfactory.

everyoneShouldKnow: Be ready to either eat in the bar or go across the street to the other fine food places. Dining area is lacking in quaility. Breakfast buffet on Sunday was always out of food.
title: Hotel concierge service--food service
comment: 12th floor Star members area is awesome. Tina who is the hostess there did an awesome job each night and the few mornings she stopped by. However, the food served to our group for the week while there was lacking in qualiy. We had sausage biscuits one morning that were rock hard. Facilities are in great shape though.

everyoneShouldKnow: Extremely high customer service
title: Great hotel, great staff.
comment: Upgraded to Dallas Suite upon check-in, very nice surprise. Front desk staff, concierge staff and all I encountered greeted me with a smile and a have a good day, night, etc. Room clean and welcoming. Club Lounge staff so cheerful and helpful, couldnt have had a better stay just wish I could have been there longer.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is great!
title: Nice hotel, but a bit on the average
comment: This was a comfortable hotel to stay in during my visit to Santa Monica. I would not say that it wowed me in any way, except for the attention of the staff. At some hotels the staff can be non-existant or not acknowledge you. The staff at Sheriton Delfina were superb. Always there to open a door, help you with finding things, making a mean cocktail, getting a cab as soon as possible. I think the staff should get all the credit for making my stay pleasant. A note to others: the fitness room is out of commission at the moment.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't expect a perfect new room, but it will be clean. Expect to pay a high price for on-site food.
title: Conference Stay
comment: I recently stayed at the Dolphin for a conference. I was somewhat unsure if I picked the right place based on reviews I have read. Upon arrival to my room I saw what others had mentioned in that the room seemed dated and in the need of updating. But overall and I spent six days there and it was kept very clean which to me is important. What people have to understand is that this hotel is used heavily by families and the rooms show it.

everyoneShouldKnow: Convenient location with great possibilities.
title: Nice New Property
comment: The staff upon arrival is very helpful and pleasant. Check in process could be faster, but not bad. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. We frequented the bar, casino, and the restaurant, all very pleasant and reasonable value. Roof top pool is nice too. The location is very convenient to main airport, Isla Grande airport, cruise terminal and Old San Juan. Also went to Texas Brazil restaurant which is located in same building. We use this property as first and or last night in San Juan, very easy location to get the best of San Juan without staying in other popular sections. Only really viable Grandbourne property in San Juan.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great service
title: Hotel
comment: Good service, friendly, welcoming and well kept. Except for temporary downtime on the swimming pool had a great time.

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff's Southern hospitality is very genuine.
title: Excellent service and great food
comment: The staff at the hotel were consistently friendly and attentive and went way beyond the level of service I have experienced at most hotels.

everyoneShouldKnow: Currently, it is the best buy in lodging downtown, at least for this level of comfort and convenience (it is close to all the action and on a downtown trolley route).
title: A Pleasant Stay
comment: I recently took my elderly mother, my teenage son, and my 7-year-old nephew here for a few days' recreation during Spring Break. We all enjoyed our stay here, although our ages ranged from seven to seventy-six. The indoor pool was beautifully maintained, and I spoke a few minutes with the man who does the pool maintenance and complimented him on his work--he was very cordial. My teenage son loved the wireless Internet and the generous "Continental Breakfast" on the VIP floor. Lucy took care of us every moring we were there, and she did a wonderful job of making us feel at home and insuring all was well. As for the Internet, I have never had service that was so reliable and easy to connect to, even on the 10th floor--and I travel quite a bit for both business and recreation. Our room was clean and well-kept, as were the other areas of the hotel. I had read the service reviews, but I can see a change at this hotel--everyone from the front desk to the young woman in the gift shop went out of their way to insure an enjoyable stay. Thanks!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great hot tub, small rooms but very clean with excellent, friendly hotel staff.
title: Nice resort-style hotel
comment: A very busy hotel with lots of features including a massive lagoon pool and new fitness equipment. The pub-style restaurant bar is nice and the waitstaff are excellent. Just very over-priced for a pub however the food was very good. The main restaurant has a great buffet breakfast and the service was wonderful. Rooms were very clean and the hotel has stunning views if you're lucky enough to get into the marina building. Really nice hot tub that is quite large and actually HOT. Too bad the pool was so cold. Great hotel and the staff are excellent.

everyoneShouldKnow: Front desk staff needs courtesy training
title: Rude front desk staff
comment: Upon request for late checkout-was told that I am not a BPG Gold member and not entitled to that feature. After Gold membership was confirmed,was reluctantly given until 2:00PM. Very rude & condescending attitude by desk clerk-in front of other guests.I wrote of my concerns to manager and received no reply in three weeks.

title: Southern Hospitality
comment: From the very helpful staff to the fresh, comfortable room, the hotel and facilities were great. They even found the clothes we left and returned them to us via FedEx. Yes, we will stay there again when in the area.

title: A Disappointment
comment: My girlfriends and I chose this hotel for a very special night out, my bachelorette party. We requested adjoining rooms and double beds in each room. Though the request was made months in advance, the Belvoir did not accomodate us. My bridesmaids and I were then floors apart from each other and were all forced to sleep in one bed (since the air mattress provided to us, after we requested it, was 'left over' from a previous guest - according to the attendant. Who knows where that had been!) I also noticed that outlet covers were falling off the outlets in our rooms. The rooms were very cramped and were certainly not worth the exceedingly expensive rate. Though we were given 'breakfast' at a special lounge in the hotel, the breakfast was lack-luster. There were slimy-looking pieces of fruit, coffee, and maybe two pastries. The expresso machine was broken and the attendant made no effort to fix it. Finally, the Belvoir did not validate, or even discount, our very expensive parking. We will never go back again. Very hard to come up with anything good to say about this hotel.

everyoneShouldKnow: Exceptional Service from everyone valet to front desk, room service and concierge
title: BEST SERVICE EVER!
comment: My family recently stayed at your hotel and have to say that we received the best customer service ever. The front desk checked us into our club level room and asked if we were there for a special event, which we were. It was our boys birthdays and the desk gave us a voucher for the breakfast buffet and an in room movie to watch that night after we returned from Universal Studios. Everyone went above and beyond to make sure everyhting was to the the club lounge.We can not wait to perfect for our stay. Our boys loved going go back.

everyoneShouldKnow: Needs renovation and customer service training.
title: Rudeness Times 10!!!!
comment: Upon arrival not greeted as Platinum Guest and did not receive any amenities until asked. Keys would not function in room, elevator or Club Lounge (three sets of keys given). When front desk clerk asked why nothing was right, she stated, "I was busy and did not have time." Closet door broken and would not open. Furniture old and shabby from the 70s. Terrible experience and never again!!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great Customer Service
title: Exceeded Expectations
comment: I recently spent 4 nights at the Belvoir Pasadena with my teenage daughter. She was attending a conference.

everyoneShouldKnow: Don't go to the time share presentation!! Biggest mistake of your life!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
title: customer service
comment: Dear Public,

everyoneShouldKnow: The staff is really rude.
title: Horrible Serivce
comment: While the rooms at this hotel are nice. The staff on the other hand is the complete opposite. Rude, incompetent, and not at all understanding. Not only was I double charged for parking which i tried to explain to the one of the ladies at the check out desk but she refuse to do anything about it. Additionally on another occasion i made a staff there aware that outside my room i had put the decline room service sign and was not given a 5 dollar voucher or 500 BPG points. And she just kept interrupting me while i was trying to explain to her what was going on. And ultimately did nothing about it and told me it I must of made a mistake. ( How can i possible make a mistake i put the sign outside my room before 2am) Clearly at this Belvoir customers do not come first at all. This hotel has the potential to be a top notch hotel only if the staff werent so rude.

everyoneShouldKnow: Poor Night Front Desk Service - not good for business folks and BPG status members
title: BPG Standards??
comment: As a globe trotter, I have to say that the BPG standards in the US BPG brands fall way below consistent standards in one major category

everyoneShouldKnow: Very close to the airport...almost walking distance. Very loud. Walls are "paper thin."
title: Defeated the Purpose
comment: We had a 6:30am flight back home out of ABQ after a week long vacation in NewMexico/Colorado. The plan was to get some rest Saturday night before the early flight. Wrong! First I had to wait over an hour for the shuttle to pick me up from the rental car center...I had to call and give my name three times. Then at 2am, a party broke out in the hallway and nearby rooms on the BPG floor. I tried to call the lobby for over an hour...no answer. I went downstairs and there was no one to be found. The party then moved to the room next to mine...it was extremely loud...the walls must be paper thin. The party noise finally stopped at 4am...just in time for us to wake up at 4:30 am...a well rested 30 minute slumber! This was by far the worst experience I've had at a Grandbourne property. The positives...very close and convenient to the airport and the hotel was clean!

everyoneShouldKnow: Location
title: AC Belvoir
comment: Rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff was polite and helpful. Beautiful hotel, great view of the city.

everyoneShouldKnow: If you are platinum status, the free transportation to nearby restaurants and shopping malls is an invaluable service
title: BPG elite recognition exceptional
comment: My second stay at this hotel. Overall, quite satisfied with the suite upgrade. Lovely room and L`Occitane ammenities.

everyoneShouldKnow: IT'S DISGUSTING
title: Vegetarians not welcome
comment: We found a MARROW BONE behind the front curtain of room 425. We called the desk, put it outside the door and it was STILL THERE next morning. We brought it to the front desk; the manager obviously was not up to the task of handling that OR the cleanliness issue OR a bill issue. The beautiful grotto belies a disgusting, foul and unorganized mess.

everyoneShouldKnow: Walking distance to little italy, chinatown, and west village.
title: Perfect Location
comment: Staff was extremely helpful and attentive, room had a great view, and we got a free breakfast when we mentioned that we were celebrating a birthday!

title: Better options within the area
comment: We had planned a few days' holidays in the DC area. But we had commitments in Maryland, so we thought that this hotel made sense.

title: Yellow Ribbon
comment: My wife and I stayed this week 03/23/2012 thru 03/25/2012, Had one of the BEST check-in ever. The Staff was so nice and took care of every need we had. I will stay with them again if wee stay in Birmingham Al. All the staff that was at the front desk went over and above to make check-in and our stay excellent. Thanks so much for this was a special time for us and our family.

everyoneShouldKnow: Shuttle to Disneyland was very helpful
title: bathroom needs & the positive
comment: The bathrooms are equipped with a 1 shelf sink/vanity table where the towels & hair dryer are stored. It could have at least a rack for the hand towel since the only place to put the toiletries is on the vanity top along with the glasses, hand towlels etc.

everyoneShouldKnow: hotel is under rated as a 2 star. Great BPG starpoint value.
title: wonderful stay
comment: stayed for 4 nights while in town visiting friends. Very clean and staff friendly and accomodating. My 10 year old son enjoyed pool with his friend. Great BPG starpoint value. Will definitely stay here again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for EVERTHING in the Upper Mahatten area.
title: My stay at the Belvoir Towers in NYC
comment: The hotel and service was first class in every respect. The club room breakfast as well as the evening cocktail hour far exceeded anything I've has in other Belvoir Hotels over the past several years. I can't wait to come in March of 2013. Congratulations for providing a superior experience.

everyoneShouldKnow: Not for business travel - no club lounge, unreliable WIFI and computer/printing access is very limited when working at all.
title: Behind the times
comment: The rooms are dated, but adequate and clean. The housekeeping service is aggressive with their attempts to turn rooms quickly given the guest demand. The front desk is courteous, but woefully inept with the WIFI or anything related to Belvoir "Linked" - I finally went down the street to the Belvoir Park and used their business services.

everyoneShouldKnow: Does not reserve what YOU order!
title: Unsatisfactory
comment: Was very disappointed that our room was NOT what was reserved. Instead of the 2 doubles reserved, only one king bed was available. Reservation was made for family of 4/2 adults + 2 children. Only due to illness did my wife stay home with other son but the purpose of 2 beds was to be able to sleep comfortably; this could NOT be accomplished with son who was all over the bed. We expected better service from a hotel such as the Belvoir, which is why we were willing to pay higher price for room reservation.

everyoneShouldKnow: You can't beat the location!
title: Renovation is a success!
comment: My family LOVED staying at the Belvoir Safari (this hotel's former name). We were very concerned about the renovations because we didn't feel they were needed. But we just stayed at the newly renovated Belvoir LBV, and we were pleasantly surprised at the changes! The rooms are clean and bright and automatically have a small fridge. The most welcome changes are at the pool which features plush towels, cabanas and a deluxe hot tub. And as always, the hotel is ideally located, and the staff is very helpful. We'll be back soon!

everyoneShouldKnow: Great staff -- they work hard to make you feel at home
title: Feels Like Home
comment: I travel 2-3 weeks a month on business, and I won't stay anywhere else in this area besides the Belvoir Universal City. The staff is warm and welcoming, and really makes me feel like I am at 'home' not just a strange customer in a strange hotel. I love this place so much, I recently used it for a long weekend vacation! This is the first time I have used a hotel for both business and pleasure. Hats off to a great staff, especially the front desk staff for working hard to accomodate my wishes. Also, I usually order room service for breakfast, and my server even knows what I want and adds it to the tray even if I forget to order it! I love this place!

everyoneShouldKnow: It a very friendly place to stay and convient to attractions.
title: This hotel was very clean and centrally located
comment: This hotel was very clean and friendly. When we had a problem with the AC, it was addressed immediately. The suite we were given had a nice view and very roomy. We were amazed by the seating areas. The local resturants were very nice also. We would come again

everyoneShouldKnow: Very comfortable. Great staff. Everyone was so friendly.
title: DeeDee12
comment: The hotel met all my expectations: cleanliness, comfortable, good food. I can't wait to do it again.

everyoneShouldKnow: Great location for Louisville
title: Perfect in Louisville
comment: I am on my last night on business in Louisville. I was fortunate to find a Belvoir in Jeffersonville, IN just across the river from downtown Louisville. Not only was the hotel a great location but the hotel itself far exceeded my expectations. The hotel is extremely clean and the staff are beyond friendly. In particular the concierge Frank is truly an ambassador for the city and the the hotel. Remembered me by name everytime I saw him and gave me a great tour of Louisville on the way back in the shuttle. I would stay here again just to listen to Frank. Great Job Belvoir Jeffersonvile!!

everyoneShouldKnow: Best location in Waikiki
title: Pool area has too many interlopers
comment: Overall the hotel is very good and we would stay there again. The only two comments I have are about the food and the pool. Firstly, the food menu at the various venues are too similar and there is too much unhealthy food ie. french fries.

everyoneShouldKnow: Rooms smell of mold and are very damp.
title: Disappointed this hotel is part of the Belvoir brand
comment: Immediately upon walking into the room it smelled of mold and was very damp. The location was great but that is about the only good thing that could be said. The room was not cleaned until after 5 PM each day and I had to ask for more towels because room service insisted on only leaving one each time. The Internet was out for over 24 hours while we were guests. It worked intermittently the remainder of the time. I am shocked this hotel is part of the Belvoir brand.

everyoneShouldKnow: Completely Unsafe
title: Completely Unsecure Building
comment: Hotel was fine... unfortunately, they left every folio out on the floor -- in the hallway and didnt event try to slide it under the door.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location and friendly staff
title: Hotel in good location
comment: Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Hotel located in good location next to Cumberland mall where there is a good selection of restaurants for dining. Fitness center is minimal but sufficient. Parking was not complimentary which would have been nice .

everyoneShouldKnow: other properties are a better value- disappointment
title: more like a 2 star
comment: This resort is more like a 2 star property. The room is similar to one that you would find on any highway by a town. The prices for food and drink were like a 5 star resort. The pool and landscaping areas were dirty and littered. Several other factors that indicated this was not an up-scale resort!

everyoneShouldKnow: Outstanding/Friendly Staff
title: Wonderful Hotel
comment: I had the opportunity to stay at the Belvoir Atlanta Hotel for 2 nights and I was very happy with the overall cleanliness, comfort, service, and F&B Operations. The hotel is very convenient to all things Atlanta and their transportation grid.

everyoneShouldKnow: The hotel was subpar, the location is awesome but not worth the uncleanliness of the room.
title: St. Patty's Stay
comment: I booked this room well in advance and paid the entire, non-refundable rate for one night. At check-in, on 3/17/12, they wanted a deposit for incidentals. I've never paid a deposit for incidentals and there was no prior mention of the requirement for a deposit. The requested deposit to be held on my credit card was 1.5 times the amount I already paid for the room. I disagreed with this outlandish amount. They then offered an option of a refundable cash deposit which ended up being about one-fifth of the cost of the room. The amount that was proposed to be held on my credit card was 6 times that of the refundable cash depositRIDICULOUS discrepancy.

everyoneShouldKnow: It's a smaller, older-style hotel, not a huge complex with many shops and restaurants.
title: A quiet, older-style resort
comment: This is an older-style resort that has been modernized. It is smaller and less crowded than some of the big new resorts. I liked it because there are fewer people and it's more relaxing. There are few shops in the resort; it's clearly a resort and not a shopping center.

everyoneShouldKnow: Very accomodating
title: great features and location
comment: I have nothing but nice things to say about my stay. The staff was always accomodating. The location was good. Seven blocks from King Street. Several restaurants within a couple blocks. Van drove you downtown or to the Metro free of charge. Will definitely go back to this location.

everyoneShouldKnow: It is not close to the arch.
title: Most comfortable beds
comment: Pleased overall with hotel. Staff nice, attentive, and helpful. Comfort of beds and sleep was beyond expecation. Only negative is housekpeeing forgot to remove food items of previous occupants from refrigerator.

everyoneShouldKnow: Good location, old hotel
title: Nice beach for BBQ!
comment: Hotel room is quite old, which can be told from all the details - furniture, bathroom, television... Pool is not big, and full of people in the afternoon.

everyoneShouldKnow: Tell your MOD's to get off the internet and come assist folks at the desk.
title: Poor staffing/beds
comment: Arrived at 7:00 pm and had to wait 20 minutes in line with only one associate serving guests. Was then told no breakfast for Platinum members which has changed in just a couple months. Bed is as firm as...well just put your own description in here, and leaving on Tuesday morning at 9:15, had to wait 15 minutes until finally asking the bellhop to check on someone in the office. Girl who came out several minutes later would be better served selling mascara behind a mall counter than running a hotel. Poor staffing, beds but you get what you pay for.

everyoneShouldKnow: Worse service and incompetent employees.
title: Worse experience.
comment: I had one of the worse experience staying at this property. My checking in time was one hour one of the most incompetent person behind the desk. No directions were given for parking or room for a person who is staying first time at this propert with family. Next day my bathroom roof started leaking the person who came to look at it was very rude. The employees at the bar by the pool were

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff and services OUTSTANDING
title: Service With A Smile
comment: We were treated like family, the front desk were friendly and efficient, Anil and the beach staff unbelievable! The bar, beach and pool waitstaff April, Jackiewere so fast and courteous. DosCamingos bartenders outstanding! Everyhotel should use this hotel as a model to copy.

everyoneShouldKnow: Staff is Excellent
title: Great Facility and Staff
comment: The Belvoir lived up to its brand promise of being warm, connected and part of the community.

everyoneShouldKnow: The employees went out of their way to help even though at times it was chaotic with lots of people in the lobby.
title: Outstanding in every way
comment: Stayed here pre and post Caribbean cruise. The room was impeccable and the check in was smooth. LOVED THE SHEETS on the bed and the duvet. Would love to know where Belvoir got them. Made for a very comfortable night's sleep. Food was delicious in the restaurant also. Will definitely stay here if room available on next visit. Thank you to all the staff who made this visit so enjoyable.

everyoneShouldKnow: Meets expectations.
title: Exactly what you need.
comment: This hotel is the perfect stop, whether it be a solo trip or with a group. Everything is up to a great standard, and the elevator trip is always fun being all glass. The fitness center, and pool are a little hidden away, but they're very efficient for the job. Looking forward to my upcoming stays here this summer.

title: Airport choice,
comment: This is my airport go-to hotel whenever I have a stop over at LAX. The staff, the location, the hotel, everything meets the standards of someone who wants comfort.

title: You bounce your Preferred Guests???
comment: I was highly disappointed and downright angry when I arrived for check-in, only to find out that the hotel was oversold, and that I would have to relocate to a competitor's hotel. Is this how you treat your Preferred Guests? What does "Preferred" mean to you? When I checked in on a seperate reservation 2 days earlier, I informed the desk clerk that I would be arriving late (12:30 AM), and she noted it in my reservation. The last thing I want to have to do at that time of day is pack up my belongings again, and move to another hotel. I work for the airlines, and while I understand the rationale behind overbooking, I also know that our high level frequent fliers are accomodated when an overbooking occurs. This will definitely factor into my decision on whom to give my business in the years ahead.

title: Great turnaround
comment: So i am a frequent traveller to Honolulu as i own a business there. I have stayed at all 4 of the Grandbourne properties several times each (this hotel probably 20 plus times) I have been around for the renovations etc.. over the past 3-4 years and while the renovtions have made the property great (especially for younger kids) since the renovations I have been very disapointed with the service. In November the service was so bad that we even checked out a cuple of days early from the hotel in frustration. When booking the family coming over in March, the kids really wanted to go to that pool, so I said we would give it one more chance. We were also using points to stay so my expectations were very low as to the service/room etc... we would get. I have to say, I think customer service has been a point or training for the folks over at Belvoir Waikiki. I was thoroughly impressed with the staff from Front desk, to housekeeping, to the lounge, to the pool area. Everyone gave my family the respect and service level one would expect in such a hotel. Thanks!

everyoneShouldKnow: Excellent and helpful staff.
title: Excellent Service
comment: We enjoyed our stay and the facility is excellent. Especially appreciated the service of the Assistant Director of Guest Services.

everyoneShouldKnow: This hotel was everything we could ask for and more.
title: Mr & Mrs
comment: We had the occasion of staying at the Belvoir in Plantation from March 12 to March 26, 2012. The accommodations were excellent, as well as the food in the restaurant. We were very very impressed with one of your front desk employees who went out of her way to be extremely helpful, pleasant and accommodating. This is not to say that the other employees were not firendly and accommodating. This employee was "NICOLE" she has only been with you for a couple of years but it appeared from her knowledge, and willingness to give us information was second to none. Her smile was infectious. Great work from Nicole.

title: What I expected
comment: I've stayed at a lot of Belvoirs some really nice and some that are just what you have come to expect of a "remodeled" Belvoir.
